My grandfather played chess with the neighborhood kids, teaching them strategy and tactics, but they often became rowdy and distracted; the streetlights flickered, signaling it was getting dark; my sister would bring me snacks, which gave me energy; their screams grew louder, disturbing my focus; I made sure to keep an eye on my pieces, avoiding their attempts to move them; my grandmother looked on anxiously, worried about my involvement with the rough crowd; but each victory I gained bolstered my confidence.
